name: Our World in Data
headline: Research and data to make progress against the worldâs largestâ¦
description:
Poverty, disease, hunger, climate change, war, existential risks, and inequality: The world faces many great and terrifying problems. It is these large problems that our work at Our World in Data focuses on.

Our World in Data publishes an open-access publication where users can understand the state of the world today, where we are making progress and where we are falling behind. Through interactive data visualizations we can see how the world has changed; by summarizing the scientific literature we can understand why. We cover everything from global poverty to natural disasters, education and health; we have 3405 charts across 297 topics.

Our World in Data is free, open-source and provided as a public good. It has millions of users every month, and is cited in research and media across the world every day. This allows millions of people to understand the large problems the world is facing, and how we can solve them.
generated_description:
**Our World in Data: Summary**

Founded in 2013 as a part of Y Combinator's Batch W19, Our World in Data is based in Oxford, UK. This nonprofit focuses on harnessing research and data to tackle some of the world’s most pressing challenges—think poverty, disease, climate change, and inequality. With a committed team of 19 employees, their mission is clear: make information about critical global issues both accessible and understandable.

At its core, Our World in Data provides an incredible array of interactive data visualizations that help users grasp where the world is making progress and where it is falling behind. With over **13,000 charts across 120 topics**, the platform covers everything from CO₂ emissions to economic disparities and is widely recognized and cited by researchers and media outlets.

The platform is completely free and, as an open-source project, it serves as a vital tool for various stakeholders—from policymakers to educators and changemakers—who seek to drive meaningful impact in their communities and beyond.

Every month, millions of users turn to Our World in Data to make sense of complex global trends. They explore not just the data but also insights into why certain changes occur, enabling them to understand better how to contribute to a better future.

You can explore their full offerings and latest updates at [Our World in Data](https://ourworldindata.org/).

**Key Points:**
- **Foundation Year:** 2013
- **Location:** Oxford, UK
- **Mission:** Provide research and data to combat significant global issues.
- **Content:** Over 13,000 interactive charts across 120 topics.
- **Audience:** Millions of monthly users, including researchers and the general public.
- **Access:** Free and open-source. 
- **Funding:** Supported by donations and operates as a nonprofit.

If you find their work valuable, consider supporting them through donations to help continue this essential mission.
